info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 24 at 11:59AM CDT until September 24 at 3:00PM CDT by NWS Shreveport LA
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...Portions of north central and northwest Louisiana, including the following parishes, in north central Louisiana, Lincoln. In northwest Louisiana, Bienville, Bossier and Webster.
* WHEN...Until 300 PM CDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1158 AM CDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches, with isolated higher amounts, are expected over the area through mid afternoon. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Arcadia, Ringgold, Gibsland, Dubberly, Heflin, Simsboro, Lucky, Castor, Bienville, Jamestown, Bryceland, Mount Lebanon, Sailes, Brice, Ada, Ogden, Liberty Hill, Lake Bistineau North, Plum Orchard Landing and Lake Bistineau South. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON

area.areaDesc: Bienville, LA; Bossier, LA; Lincoln, LA; Webster, LA
